description: Retrieves status information about the Amazon EC2 instances associated with a Amazon GameLift FleetIQ game server group. Use this operation to detect when instances are active or not available to host new game servers. To request status for all instances in the game server group, provide a game server group ID only. To request status for specific instances, provide the game server group ID and one or more instance IDs. Use the pagination parameters to retrieve results in sequential segments. If successful, a collection of GameServerInstance objects is returned. This operation is not designed to be called with every game server claim request; this practice can cause you to exceed your API limit, which results in errors. Instead, as a best practice, cache the results and refresh your cache no more than once every 10 seconds. Amazon GameLift FleetIQ Guide.

parameters.name: GameServerGroupName
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the game server group. Use either the name or ARN value.

parameters.name: InstanceIds
parameters.description: The Amazon EC2 instance IDs that you want to retrieve status on. Amazon EC2 instance IDs use a 17-character format, for example: i-1234567890abcdef0. To retrieve all instances in the game server group, leave this parameter empty. (string) ---

nested_items.name: GameServerInstances
nested_items.description: The collection of requested game server instances.

nested_items.name: GameServerGroupName
nested_items.description: A developer-defined identifier for the game server group that includes the game server instance. The name is unique for each Region in each Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: GameServerGroupArn
nested_items.description: A generated unique identifier for the game server group that includes the game server instance.

nested_items.name: InstanceId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the instance where the game server is running. This ID is available in the instance metadata. EC2 instance IDs use a 17-character format, for example: i-1234567890abcdef0.

nested_items.name: InstanceStatus
nested_items.description: Current status of the game server instance.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: A token that indicates where to resume retrieving results on the next call to this operation. If no token is returned, these results represent the end of the list.
